body:
Hello @jbrockmendel! Thanks for updating the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/dtypes/cast.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/core/dtypes/cast.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/series.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/core/series.py) !

 - In the file [`pandas/core/tools/datetimes.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/core/tools/datetimes.py), following                are the PEP8 issues :
> [Line 554:80](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/core/tools/datetimes.py#L554): [E501](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20E501) line too long (102 > 79 characters)


 - In the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/datetimes/test_construction.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/tests/indexes/datetimes/test_construction.py), following                are the PEP8 issues :
> [Line 286:28](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/tests/indexes/datetimes/test_construction.py#L286): [E127](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20E127) continuation line over-indented for visual indent


 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/indexes/datetimes/test_tools.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/tests/indexes/datetimes/test_tools.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/tslibs/test_array_to_datetime.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/tests/tslibs/test_array_to_datetime.py) !

 - In the file [`pandas/util/testing.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/util/testing.py), following                are the PEP8 issues :
> [Line 969:80](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/ec3500291237347ebbffa7745c54b3c1c58087cf/pandas/util/testing.py#L969): [E501](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=pep8%20E501) line too long (80 > 79 characters)




##### Comment last updated on December 09, 2018 at 00:46 Hours UTC

Response to your questions:

1) During my `is_utc` overall, I added a test for a case where a dateutil UTC was getting coerced to a pytz UTC. IMO I think it's a bug if we coerce dateutil objects to pytz objects or vice versa so those test should be fixed. https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/commit/94ce05d1bcc3c99e992c48cc99d0fd2726f43102#diff-ad26614f192ef4be1906047f739c3644R592

1-sidenote) The interesting case becomes what happens if you mix dateutil and pytz objects (same timezone or not). My gut reaction is to cast to object, but I could see how raising could also be appropriate.

2) I agree that the second behavior is better than the first.

2b) Well the datetime64 will _technically_ always be naive since its the numpy type? But I think more to your point, I think it should represent UTC inside  `array_to_datetime` and should return UTC if timezone info was parsed.

> still relevant?

Yes.  I'm in a less-active phase at the moment, but this is still a problem that needs to be solved.  I'll return to it before too long.
